pattern.name: Time of peak
pattern.description:
Time, when a numerical attribute reaches its minimum/maximum. In case of a tie the most recent value is returned.
Note: NumericalColumn can be null and that can cause ties -> avoid nulls. However, ties can still happen -> pick the most recent (the maximum) time value (note that it also deals with ties at temporalColumn level).
NOTE: Could depend on the temporal constraint rather than on a time column.
pattern.example: When did the customer transfer the biggest amount.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @base , max(@temporalColumn) AS @columnName FROM (SELECT @base , @temporalColumn , RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY @basePartitionBy ORDER BY @numericalColumn @sortOrder) AS rk FROM @propagatedTable WHERE @numericalColumn IS NOT NULL ) t WHERE rk = 1 GROUP BY @base
